Comment: When people talk about the media being complicit and in large part responsible for how we‚Äôve arrived at this moment in history, this is what they are talking about.¬†  I get that this doorknob said this outrageous thing and given his proximity to power it is ‚Äúnewsworthy‚Äù, But the rest of the article goes on to entertain the premise of Miller‚Äôs point. And the appropriate response should be that Miller is asking to change a clear and core component of the very document that gives his boss any authority - and to affect that change with methods that are not authorized by the same document.¬†  This entire article should read, ‚ÄúStephen Miller wants to change the Constitution. As we all know here‚Äôs are the methods that are written into the Constitution to revise, revoke or introduce an amendment to accomplish that change. There is no way that Miller or his ilk can get that done and so his problems with the amendment are moot. If Miller and pals try any other way around getting what he wants, our system of government has failed and we no longer live in a democratic republic.‚Äù ¬†  Nothing about that isn‚Äôt honest or factual. I get that news outlets want to appear fair and unbiased. But they seem to not understand that rational people already think they‚Äôre biased ¬†because news outlets so clearly and continually entertain absolute lunacy.¬†  Stop accepting every premise to an argument! They aren‚Äôt made in good faith and they‚Äôre specifically to manipulate the news cycle. It‚Äôs so frustrating to see well meaning journalists capitulate to their billionaire bosses, not having enough self-respect to just say, ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs clearly ridiculous and wrong, how can you possibly expect to be taken seriously?‚Äù¬†

Comment: This doesn't even make any sense. Illegal immigrants, including the parents of US citizens, have been paying payroll taxes for decades even though they are not eligible for Social Security and Medicare. In a lot of cases they are even paying income taxes. They pay more than they will ever get out of the system, even if you assume all the "anchor baby" mothers spend their entire pregnancy on Medicaid. Because here's the thing, even if your child is a US citizen, if you are a Honduran or Mexican or Salvadoran national it's going to be a decades long wait for legal residency IF you ever even get approved, and until you have that residency your wages aren't going to your Social Security and Medicare eligibility.¬†   So, yes, your tax dollars are paying for the cost of destitute US citizens'¬† mothers to give birth in Medicaid. They are paying for them to get free formula and milk and cheese and produce. WIC.¬†And MAYBE a couple hundred bucks of food assistance for six months (because that's all Welfare gets you anymore.) Maybe. A large portion of low income people do not get approved for food assistance. A lot don't ever even apply. In return their relatives are paying for our Social Security and Medicare and other government services. And providing future workers to keep the whole thing going. We are coming out ahead.¬†   At least we were until these people decided to go after and eliminate the means by which illegal immigrants were paying into all our systems. It's almost as if they don't actually care about the fiscal soundness of all this at all. They just want all immigrants not of their particular ethnic persuasion out.¬†

Comment: No.  The media catering to the left can be as intentionally misleading as the media fed to the right.  They're talking about ending *jus soli* ("Right of the Soil") citizenship, which means that being born on American soil makes you an American citizen.  Most countries do not have such a policy and require at least one of the parents to be citizens.   However, the *jus soli* policy is enshrined in the constitution via amendment and cannot be overturned by executive order.  Changing it would require a constitutional amendment, which the republicans do not have the support for.

In 1722, she married a French military member. My Pop's father's family came here to escape Hitler. So, I have my Pop's family being here the longest, my grandma's family being here the longest, my grandpa, just a little over a hundred years. My mom's folks came here to escape Mussolini, and they haven't been here 100 years. My Gramp's and Nona were so proud to become citizens. My Gramp's helped me with my American Government, Civics, and Political Science classes. He had a pocket Constitution, even though he knew all of that without looking in it. It's too bad trump, miller, vance and the rest of the trash is so clueless about everything our nation is built upon. They are trash, shills for billionaires, and the only reason they are where they are is because they only want to unjustly enrich themselves at the expense of us, who pay the bills, and do the work. Comment: I mean I know all that, it's just a fun What If, let's not forget that part of the reason we have that law is because it allowed all the former slaves to be considered citizens, when previously courts had made it abundantly clear in several cases that enslaved people were not afforded the rights of citizenship. Taking it away could set up a court battle to do the opposite, would it only apply to people from that point on, or would it retroactively remove citizenship from millions of people, how many generations would have to be present before you were considered legal? Would your grandparents legal status effect yours? Your great grandparents?
